citeinfo.title: Trans_template - Digital Shoreline Analysis System Version 5.0.20180213.1225 Transect Feature Class

idinfo.useconst: These data were automatically generated using the DSAS version 5.0 software applications and should only be used for purposes explicitly stated by the originating organization.

citeinfo.title: Digital Shoreline Analysis System (version 5.0): U.S. Geological Survey software

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Coastal and Marine Geology Program

citeinfo.othercit: Suggested citation: Himmelstoss, E.A., Farris, A.S., Henderson, R.E., Kratzmann, M.G., Ergul, A., Zhang, O., Zichichi, J.L., and Thieler, E.R., 2018, Digital Shoreline Analysis System (ver. 5.0): U.S. Geological Survey software, https://doi.org/10.5066/P9VW42I0 .

citeinfo.title: Digital Shoreline Analysis System (DSAS) Version 5.0 User Guide

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Coastal and Marine Geology Program

citeinfo.othercit: Suggested citation: Himmelstoss, E.A., Henderson, R.E., Kratzmann, M, Farris, A., 2018, DSAS version 5.0 user guide. U.S. Geological Survey report 2018-1179, https://doi.org/10.3133/ofr20181179

dataqual.logic: These data were generated using DSAS, an automated software program which does not perform checks for fidelity of the input features. Any testing on these data should be carried out by end-users to ensure fidelity of relationships.
dataqual.complete: This dataset contains all the transects automatically generated by the version 5.0 DSAS software application.

procstep.procdesc: Transect features generated using DSAS version 5.0.20180213.1225. Parameters Used: baseline layer=_____, baseline group field=___, transect spacing=______, search distance=______, land direction=_____, shoreline intersection=____, smoothing distance=_____, For additional details on these parameters, please see the DSAS help file distributed with the DSAS software, or visit the USGS DSAS page at: https://www.usgs.gov/centers/whcmsc/science/digital-shoreline-analysis-system-dsas.

enttyp.enttypd: Transects are automatically generated by DSAS at a 90 degree angle to the user-specified baseline.
enttyp.enttypds: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique identification number of the baseline segment. If BaselineID=0 no transects will be generated. Used by DSAS to determine transect ordering alongshore if multiple baseline segments exist.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: Values in this field correlate to the optional baseline attribute field “DSAS_group” (Group_) and are assigned by DSAS if selected by user. If a user specifies an attribute field in the baseline layer as the group field (it is not name specific), then DSAS will use the provided input to assign a group value to output transects; if user does not select a baseline-group field as input, then DSAS will assign all transects a group value of zero. This field is used to aggregate sections of the coast into groups. All transects within a group will have average summary statistics in the DSAS summary report.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: Assigned by DSAS based on ordering of transects along the baseline. Used to allow user to sort transect data sequentially alongshore from the baseline from baseline start to baseline end.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: Assigned by DSAS to indicate whether or not a transect has been modified after generated by DSAS (0= transect was auto generated by DSAS; 1=transect has been edited).
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: Assigned by DSAS to to record the azimuth of the transect measure in degrees clockwise from North.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal meters.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
